title.narrative: DanChurchAid: RBC in East Africa, engagement

description.narrative: "Responsible business conduct in East Africa: Strengthening a multi-stakeholder approach to the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights in Ethiopia and Uganda" is a two-year project with an aim to strengthen multi-stakeholder approaches to the implementation and monitoring of the UNGPs in Uganda and Ethiopia through development of CSO capacity and establish a good practice model for meaningful participation of local right-holders and CSOs in UNGP implementation and monitoring.

title.narrative: Participation of local actors in international stakeholder engagements

description.narrative: Participation of local actors in international stakeholder engagements to build capacity and share local level experiences on multi-stakeholder engagements related to business and human rights. Dissemination of experiences to key stakeholders at international level e.g. at UN Annual Forum on business and human rights or in the margins of sessions of the Human Rights Council. Workshop in Denmark with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to ensure knowledge exchange and recommendations to include in furthering multi-stakeholder engagement practices in other Danida supported programme and project interventions with links to business and human rights.

title.narrative: Uganda: Relevant State, business and CSO actors have strengthened capacity on multi-stakeholder collaboration on implementation and monitoring of UNGPs activities

description.narrative: Select CSOs demonstrate enhanced capacity to engage activities and monitoring of implementations to secure RBC. Multi-stakeholder platform for exchange and dialogue established with relevant State, business and CSO participation. Documentation from multi-stakeholder dialogues demonstrates collaborative actions to secure implementation and roll out of NAPs activities following expectations of the normative frameworks.

title.narrative: Uganda: Relevant State, business and CSO actors have strengthened capacity on multi-stakeholder collaboration on implementation and monitoring of UNGPs activities

description.narrative: Select CSOs demonstrate enhanced capacity to engage activities and monitoring of implementations to secure RBC. Multi-stakeholder platform for exchange and dialogue established with relevant State, business and CSO participation. Documentation from multi-stakeholder dialogues demonstrates collaborative actions to secure implementation and roll out of NAPs activities following expectations of the normative frameworks.

comment.narrative: There is still limited space for collaboration and engagement between CSOs, State and the private sector on RBC. At a larger scale, there is mistrust between CSOs and the private sector and CSO actions advocating for RBC are usually criminalised. At the same time private sector are continually advocating for an enabling business environment which provide good ground for CSOs, private sector and the State to effectively collaborate in building a culture for responsible business conduct.

title.narrative: Outcome 1. National level implementation of the UNGPs in Ethiopia and Uganda.

description.narrative: Strengthen multi-stakeholder approaches and the role of civil society in advancing the practical implementation of global normative standards on responsible business conduct at local level.

comment.narrative: CSO engagement in policy development low (Uganda) or not existing (Ethiopia). CSO capacity to engage in policy development and consultations on RBC limited, strong need and interest in engaging in discussions on RBC due to rising numbers of adverse human rights impact related to business activities. Multi-stakeholder approaches limited in Ethiopia and Uganda, thus limiting opportunities for CSO engagement at regional and international level.
